definition: gas/air/smell/weather/to make angry/to annoy/to get angry/vital energy/qi

sentences.english: "At the time, " he added, "I was really brassed off (angry) about it."
sentences.chinese: 他还说，“那个时候，我真是满腹怨气”。

sentences.english: Those who strive for justice must understand that it consists of more than the venting of resentments.
sentences.chinese: 为正义而斗争的人必须懂得正义不仅是发泄怨气。
我感到一种刻毒的怨气。

sentences.english: But the realness of the blog inspires trust and piques people's curiosity.
sentences.chinese: 但是真实性的信赖和怨气博客启发人们的好奇心。

sentences.english: He hooted his complaints to me.
However, before you make that decision try the following exercise to help you to express your anger.
sentences.chinese: 不过，在拿主意前，请做下面的练习来发泄怨气。

sentences.english: This only heightened the dudgeon of the American Catholic right.
sentences.chinese: 这只会增加美国天主教右派的怨气。

sentences.english: Having known the truth, Mei felt free from anger totally.
sentences.chinese: 了解了真相，梅婧心中的怨气一扫而光。

sentences.english: “I wouldn’t use the word ‘hard feelings, ’ ” Mr. Catsimatidis said.
sentences.chinese: “我不会用‘怨气’这个词，”卡奇马提底斯先生说。

definition: to resent/to harbor a grudge against/to loathe/resentment/rancor
pent-up frustrations/sth that has accumulated in one's mind for a long time
to suffer from pent-up frustrations/mental knot/emotional issue
